text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with fried peanut butter and jelly
pinche pies and if you've never heard of
a pinche pie before that's not
surprising since I think I just made
that up I was going to call them peanut
butter and jelly fried donuts and
fritters and things like that but I
ended up with pinche pie so here we go
we're going to take some white bread and
this is not a sponsored post so I'm not
going to give the brand name you're just
going to have to wonder and I'm going to
take this round cutter and I'm going to
cut out rounds of bread and yes we all
eat we bread we all eat whole grain
bread for all our sandwiches but it's
okay once in a while to go get a loaf of
white bread you don't have to wear a
disguise in the store if you get busted
just tell people hey I'm making fried
peanut butter and jelly pinche pies what
did you want me to use so once the
breads cut I'm going to take some peanut
butter not much maybe a teaspoon and a
half maybe two teaspoons at the most and
spread it on one side of the bread do
not go all the way to the edge all right
you want to leave at least a half inch
of pure white bread around the outside
around the outside around the outside
all right I'm going to do the same thing
with the other side with in my case
strawberry jelly and then the most fun
part of the entire operation is pinching
this pie together so I'm going to pick
it up and with my thumb and forefinger
I'm going to go around the outside and
pinch the two pieces together very
firmly and that's totally blurry so let
me change shots here and because of
white breads unique texture it's going
to seal completely just pinch it really
firmly until the edges are just
completely absolutely stuck together
which is not going to be hard alright so
I did up a few of those over to the
stove where I have some vegetable oil in
a shallow pan I have about a half-inch
I'm going to heat that until it's ready
to fry how do you know here's how you
test take a little piece of white bread
and just stick it in dip it in the oil
and if it starts to bubble like that the
oil is ready for frying if not much
happens wait a little bit so once I deem
that ready to roll I put in my pinche
pies i fried them for about
approximately 2 min
it's per side but don't worry about the
time too much there's nothing to cook
inside all you want to do is fry them
until the outside is golden brown and
crispy and once that happens you are
done we're going to remove those drain
those on a paper towel you can hear how
incredibly crispy this gets unbelievable
by the way yes of course you could do
this in butter if you wanted to and then
to finish this I'm going to sprinkle
them dust them with powdered sugar
why because I hate when people dust
things with powdered sugar so here I'm
doing it to be ironic and then it was
time to taste my pinchy pie creation and
I got to tell you it was amazing and
just to give you a little sense of how
amazing listen to this and there you go
the fried peanut butter and jelly pinche
pie a great example of the wonderful
world of white-trash cuisine and don't
forget the old saying one man's white
trash is another man's white treasure so
don't judge this until you try it so
this could be a really fun project if
you're out camping with the kids and of
course using the same technique just
think of all the different kinds of
pinche pies you could make sweet savory
some in between so of course I would
totally love to hear about how you take
this technique and run with it and do
amazing things anyway I hope you give
that a try all the ingredients are on
food wishes comm so go check it out and
as always enjoy
